author: Eric Martin
description: The US State Department is denying visas to Palestinian Authority President Mahmoud Abbas and some 80 other Palestinian officials ahead of annual United Nations meetings next month, according to an official.
title: US Denies Visas to Abbas, Palestinian Officials for UN Meeting

author: Patrick Howell O'Neill
description: Homeland Security Secretary Kristi Noem announced that she fired two dozen employees from the Federal Emergency Management Agency after a review determined significant flaws had allowed a hacker to access to FEMA’s network.
title: DHS Secretary Noem Fires Two Dozen at FEMA Citing Cyber Lapses

author: Erik Larson, Zoe Tillman, Bob Van Voris, Greg Stohr
description: Most of President Donald Trump’s global tariffs were ruled illegal by a federal appeals court that found he exceeded his authority in imposing them, but the judges let the levies stay in place while sending the case back to a lower court for further proceedings.
title: Trump’s Global Tariffs Found Illegal by US Appeals Court

author: Biz Carson
description: Netflix Inc. co-founder and Chairman Reed Hastings donated $2 million on Friday to back redistricting efforts in California, financial disclosures show, extending his support of Governor Gavin Newsom.
title: Netflix Billionaire Reed Hastings Gives $2 Million In California Map Fight

author: Augusta Saraiva
description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Today, US economy reporter Augusta Saraiva rounds up the latest economic data points. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: Americans Keep Spending But They See Clouds on Horizon

author: Natalia Drozdiak, Joe Mathieu
description: Ukraine’s deal to give the US sweeping rights to natural resources projects is advancing as both sides launch operations of a fund that the Trump administration demanded in return for further support for the war-torn country, Ukraine’s economy minister said.
title: Ukraine Says Minerals Deal With US Progressing ‘Nicely’

author: Maria Eloisa Capurro
description: Federal Reserve Bank of San Francisco President Mary Daly suggested policymakers will be ready to lower interest rates soon, adding that inflation stemming from tariffs will likely prove temporary.
title: Fed’s Daly Signals Openness to Interest-Rate Cut in September

author: Erik Larson
description: Trump cabinet officials told a federal appeals court that ruling the president’s global tariffs illegal would seriously harm US foreign policy, with Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent warning of “dangerous diplomatic embarrassment.”
title: Bessent Warns of US ‘Embarrassment’ If Tariffs Ruled Illegal

author: Steven T. Dennis, Catherine Lucey
description: Iowa Republican US Senator Joni Ernst is expected to announce in the coming days she won’t seek reelection, according to people familiar with her plans, opening up a Senate seat that could determine which party controls the majority.
title: Iowa Republican Ernst Expected Not to Seek Reelection to Senate

author: Nick Wadhams
description: The Trump administration is proposing strict new visa limits for Chinese journalists in the US as part of a broader push to curtail stays by foreign students and reporters, in a move that prompted pushback from Beijing.
title: Trump Proposes 90-Day Limit on Visas for Chinese Journalists

author: Richard Bravo
description: French President Emmanuel Macron vowed a strong response if any country takes measures that undermine Europe’s digital sovereignty.
title: Macron Vows Retaliation If Europe’s Digital Sovereignty Attacked

author: Patpicha Tanakasempipat
description: The billionaire dynasty that has dominated Thailand’s politics for more than two decades has been ousted from high office yet again, with Prime Minister Paetongtarn Shinawatra dismissed by the Constitutional Court after it found her guilty of ethical misconduct.
title: Why Thailand’s Shinawatra Clan Lost Power Once Again

author: Samy Adghirni, William Horobin
description: French President Emmanuel Macron reiterated his support for Prime Minister Francois Bayrou’s decision to call a confidence vote on Sept. 8, one that may well lead to the government’s ouster.
title: Macron Backs Bayrou’s Confidence Motion, Rules Out Resigning

author: Eric Martin
description: US Secretary of State Marco Rubio is handing over the wind-down of USAID to President Donald Trump’s budget director as the administration works toward closing the international development agency it criticized as wasteful and politically misguided.
title: Rubio Hands Over USAID Closure to Trump Budget Director Vought

author: Patpicha Tanakasempipat, Pathom Sangwongwanich
description: The race to form a new government in Thailand intensified as political parties courted rivals for support just hours after a court ousted Prime Minister Paetongtarn Shinawatra for ethics violations.
title: Thai Premier Race Heats Up After Court Sacks Thaksin’s Daughter

author: Charlie Duxbury
description: Sweden’s Arctic municipality of Kiruna called for government help to relocate a third of its residents to allow the expansion of the world’s largest underground iron ore mine.
title: Arctic Town Seeks Swedish State Help With Relocation Due to Mine

author: Ntando Thukwana
description: South Africa’s state-owned postal company halted some services to the US indefinitely, after President Donald Trump revoked duty-free access for international parcels.
title: South Africa Halts Parcel Deliveries to US Over Trump Tariffs

author: Arne Delfs, Samy Adghirni
description: German Chancellor Friedrich Merz and French President Emmanuel Macron called for secondary sanctions aimed at undermining Russia’s war machine, increasing pressure on Moscow as Donald Trump’s peace efforts sputter.
title: Merz, Macron Push for Secondary Sanctions on Russian Backers

author: Lauren Dezenski, Myles Miller
description: President Donald Trump ended former Vice President Kamala Harris’ Secret Service protection, a senior White House official said, in a move aimed at his Democratic opponent in the 2024 election.
title: Trump Ends Kamala Harris’ Extended Secret Service Protection

author: Upmanyu Trivedi, Alex Morales
description: The UK government won a bid to lift a court order that banned it from housing asylum seekers in a hotel, staving off any immediate crisis over Prime Minister Keir Starmer’s immigration policy.
title: UK Wins Appeal Over Housing Asylum Seekers in Hotel Ban

author: Debby Wu, Kasia Klimasinska
description: The Trump administration will make it harder for Samsung Electronics Co. and SK Hynix Inc. to ship critical equipment to their chipmaking operations in China, dealing a potential blow to the companies’ production in the world’s largest semiconductor market.
title: Samsung, SK Hynix Lose US Waivers on Chip Gear for China Plants

author: Katy O'Donnell
description: Key Senate Democrats are pressing the Trump administration to hold off on plans to sell shares of Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac in order to study how the move would impact mortgage rates.
title: Democrats Urge White House to Pause Fannie, Freddie Share Sale

author: Vidya N Root
description: France’s unions are planning a strike on Sept. 18 to protest against Prime Minister Francois Bayrou’s budget plan, intensifying the political turmoil unleashed by his call for a confidence vote.
title: French Unions Call Sept. 18 Strike as Political Turmoil Deepens

author: Erik Larson
description: Courts should defer to President Donald Trump on whether he has sufficient “cause” to fire Federal Reserve Governor Lisa Cook, the Justice Department said in a court filing hours before the start of a high-stakes hearing in a lawsuit challenging her removal.
title: Trump Says Court Should Defer to Him on Cook Firing ‘Cause’

author: Gregory Korte
description: President Donald Trump asked Congress to claw back nearly $5 billion in already-approved foreign aid spending, a proposal timed to take advantage of the looming end of the fiscal year and allowing him to cut the funding himself if lawmakers fail to act by the close of September.
title: Trump Notifies Congress of Plan to Rescind Billions in Foreign Aid

description: Lisa Cook Photographer: Drew Angerer/Getty Images
title: Cook Judge Asks If She Suffered ‘Irreparable Harm’ From Trump Firing

author: Daryna Krasnolutska, Olesia Safronova
description: President Volodymyr Zelenskiy said he and the European leaders will “connect” next week with Donald Trump to discuss security guarantees for Ukraine.
title: Zelenskiy, Europeans to Speak With Trump on Security Gurantees Next Week

author: Patpicha Tanakasempipat, Pathom Sangwongwanich
description: The Pheu Thai Party plans to head negotiations to forge Thailand’s new government coalition that will also nominate the country’s next leader, Caretaker Prime Minister Phumtham Wechayachai said following the Constitutional Court’s verdict on ethics that ended Paetongtarn Shinawatra’s premiership.
title: Pheu Thai to Lead New Coalition in Thailand, Caretaker PM Says

author: Heidi Taksdal Skjeseth
description: An outburst by US Senator Lindsey Graham at Norway’s sovereign wealth fund over its divestment of Caterpillar Inc. prompted a response by the Nordic nation’s prime minister to explain the government has no role in the fund’s decisions, his office said.
title: Norway Leader Rebukes US Senator Graham’s Criticism of $2 Trillion Fund

author: Alastair Gale
description: The US declined for the first time to send any uniformed military or government personnel to speak at a key security conference organized by the UK and held in Japan this year, even as regional allies seek to strengthen coordination.
title: US Military, Government Skip Asia Security Forum for First Time

author: Eltaf Najafizada
description: The Taliban government warned that recent airstrikes by Pakistan on two provinces of Afghanistan, which killed civilians, will have “consequences” and escalate cross border tensions.
title: Taliban Says Pakistan Will Face ‘Consequences’ After Airstrikes

author: Denis Chabrol
description: Opposition presidential candidates are pledging to renegotiate Exxon’s oil contract to help alleviate rising inflation in the South American nation.
title: Guyana Election Rivals Want a Bigger State Share of Oil Revenue

author: Dan Strumpf
description: India’s premier is visiting Japan before heading to a summit of regional leaders in China
title: Modi Pivots to Asia as US-India Relations Sour

author: Kamlesh Bhuckory
description: Mauritian Prime Minister Navinchandra Ramgoolam fired a deputy governor at the central bank, a local news website reported, following weeks of tension at the helm of the monetary authority.
title: Mauritius Premier Fires Deputy Central Banker, l’Express Says

author: Ellen Milligan
description: The UK barred Israeli administration officials from attending a flagship defense exhibition in London because of its military offensive in Gaza, a move that further frayed relations between the two governments.
title: UK Bars Israel From London Defense Expo Over New Gaza Offensive

author: John Liu, Fran Wang
description: China’s top leaders vowed to advance ethnic unity through new legislation, marking the latest step in a sweeping drive to deepen the integration and control of minority groups.
title: China Politburo Reviews Draft Law to Push Ethnic Unity Agenda

author: Nduka Orjinmo, Ruth Olurounbi
description: The price of shea nuts, which are used in cosmetics and confectionery, plunged in Nigeria after the government joined other West African countries in banning exports.
title: Shea Nut Prices Plunge After Nigeria Announces Ban on Exports

author: Shruti Srivastava
description: India and the US are keeping informal communication channels open, and New Delhi has no immediate plans to retaliate against President Donald Trump’s 50% tariffs on the South Asian nation, according to an official familiar with the matter.
title: India Holds Informal US Talks, Rules Out Retaliation for Now

author: Patpicha Tanakasempipat
description: Thailand was thrust into deeper political crisis after the Constitutional Court dismissed Prime Minister Paetongtarn Shinawatra for ethics violations, setting off the search for a third leader in two years.
title: Thai Court Removes Premier Paetongtarn for Ethics Violation

author: Ryan Weeks, Suvashree Ghosh
description: Eric Trump, the son of US President Donald Trump, called China “a hell of a power” in crypto even though the nation has largely banned digital-token trading since 2021.
title: Eric Trump Calls China ‘a Hell of a Power’ in Digital Assets

author: Colum Murphy
description: China questioned Europe’s plan to snap back into place sanctions on Iran over the nation’s nuclear program, warning it could make the situation worse.
title: China Denounces Iran Snapback Sanctions Plan as Not Constructive

author: Andrea Palasciano, Sanne Wass
description: Secondary sanctions and measures aimed at Russia’s energy sector would be most effective in curbing Moscow’s ability to wage war against Ukraine, according to the European Union’s foreign policy chief, Kaja Kallas.
title: EU’s Top Diplomat Touts Secondary Sanctions Against Russia

author: Colum Murphy
description: China said improving ties with India is in the interest of both countries, and the two sides have taken steps to steadily stabilize relations after a meeting between President Xi Jinping and Prime Minister Narendra Modi last year.
title: China Says Stronger Ties With India Is in Interest of Both Sides

author: Ainsley Thomson
description: Reserve Bank of New Zealand Chair Neil Quigley has resigned from his post, just six months after former governor Adrian Orr quit the central bank.
title: RBNZ Chair Neil Quigley Quits Just Six Months After Orr

author: James Woolcock
description: Lobbyists are lining up to attend Reform UK’s annual conference next week in a sign corporate Britain is increasingly taking Nigel Farage’s outfit seriously as an electoral force.
title: Farage’s Reform Lures UK Lobbyists in Sign of Building Momentum

author: William Horobin, Tom Fevrier
description: Francois Bayrou is clinging to a slim chance of remaining France’s prime minister as parliamentary math leaves only a narrow path to survival in his self-inflicted confidence vote.
title: French Prime Minister Seeks a Narrow Path to Political Survival

author: Heesu Lee
description: North Korea’s economy grew last year at its fastest pace since 2016, according to South Korea’s central bank, as Kim Jong Un tightens ties with Moscow and trade with China continues to increase.
title: North Korea’s Economy Expands as Kim Deepens Ties With Putin, Xi

author: Soo-Hyang Choi
description: Just days after US President Donald Trump said he’d like to meet North Korean leader Kim Jong Un, Pyongyang responded in its own way, by announcing Kim’s trip to join Russian President Vladimir Putin at China’s military parade.
title: Kim’s China Trip Shows Shifting Dynamics in Nuclear Diplomacy

author: Chandra Asmara, Prima Wirayani
description: Indonesia is bracing for more protests on Friday after a motorcycle taxi driver was killed in clashes between demonstrators and the police, fueling public anger against the government and raising questions about President Prabowo Subianto’s handling of dissent.
title: Protests Rock Indonesia as One Dies in Clash, Markets Slump

author: Daniel Carvalho
description: Brazilian President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva authorized the start of a process to retaliate against the 50% tariffs imposed by Donald Trump, Vice President Geraldo Alckmin said.
title: Lula Authorizes Retaliation Process Against Trump’s Tariffs

description: Home Office minister Seema Malhotra has hailed a joint operation with European Union partners, which has seized more than £66 million worth of cocaine, as the future for tackling organised drug gangs as well as people smugglers.
title: Home Office Minister Praises Joint EU Operation to Smash Drug Smuggler Gangs

author: Zoe Tillman
description: A federal appeals court ruled that a fast-moving fight over the Trump administration’s effort to block billions of dollars in foreign assistance approved by Congress can move forward as a large chunk of funds are set to expire.
title: Appeals Court Keeps Fight Alive Over Trump Foreign Aid Freeze

author: Josh Wingrove
description: Federal Housing Finance Agency Director Bill Pulte sent a new criminal referral against Federal Reserve Governor Lisa Cook, intensifying the Trump administration’s pressure campaign against the central bank board member over allegations of mortgage fraud.
title: Pulte Ups Cook Scrutiny With Criminal Referral on Third Mortgage
